dt: {bc}a strong desire to achieve something high or great
{bc}a drawing of something in, out, up, or through by or as if by suction: such as
{bc}the act of breathing and especially of breathing in
{bc}the withdrawal (as by suction) of fluid or tissue from the body
{bc}the taking of foreign matter into the lungs with the respiratory current

dt.t: problems caused by the {wi}aspiration{/wi} of fluids into the patient's lungs

dt: {bc}audible breath that accompanies or comprises a speech sound
{bc}the pronunciation or addition of an aspiration

dt.t: the {wi}aspiration{/wi} of the letter "h" in "a house"

pt: {sc}ambition{/sc} {sc}aspiration{/sc} {sc}pretension{/sc} mean strong desire for advancement. {sc}ambition{/sc} applies to the desire for personal advancement or preferment and may suggest equally a praiseworthy or an inordinate desire.
{sc}aspiration{/sc} implies a striving after something higher than oneself.
{sc}pretension{/sc} suggests ardent desire for recognition of accomplishment often without actual possession of the necessary ability and therefore may imply presumption.

shortdef: a strong desire to achieve something high or great —usually plural
a drawing of something in, out, up, or through by or as if by suction: such as
